summary_points: 1. CarMax's retail used unit sales decreased 5.4% year-over-year in the second quarter of fiscal year 2026 (ended August 31, 2025), while comparable store used unit sales decreased 6.3%.
2. CarMax Auto Finance (CAF) income decreased 11.2% to $102.6 million in Q2 FY2026, primarily due to a higher provision for loan losses ($142.2 million) outweighing net interest margin growth.
3. CarMax plans to reduce SG&A expenses by at least $150 million over the next 18 months (by the end of fiscal year 2027), with some savings expected in fiscal year 2026.

1. Starbucks announced a restructuring plan on September 23, 2025, resulting in $1 billion in charges, including $600 million in future cash expenditures and the closure of approximately 180 North American coffeehouses.
2.  By the end of fiscal year 2025, this will reduce the number of company-operated coffeehouses in North America by 1%, leaving approximately 18,300 locations.
3.  $400 million of the restructuring charges are non-cash expenditures.
1. Accenture plc reported fiscal year 2025 revenues of $69.7 billion, a 7% increase year-over-year in both U.S. dollars and local currency.

2.  For the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2025, Accenture initiated a six-month business optimization program resulting in a $615 million charge and an expected additional $250 million charge in the first quarter of fiscal year 2026.
3. Accenture predicts full-year fiscal 2026 revenue growth of 2% to 5% in local currency, or 3% to 6% excluding a projected 1% to 1.5% impact from its U.S. federal business.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$779,878,391 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its 2021 stock repurchase program as of September 24, 2025.
2. On September 24, 2025, News Corp bought back a total of 36,015,897 shares (24,164,507 Class A and 11,851,390 Class B), costing US$779,878,391  in total consideration.
3. News Corp has two active stock repurchase programs, each authorized for US$1 billion, with the intention to repurchase additional shares subject to market conditions.
1. NRG Energy, Inc. priced concurrent offerings totaling $5,000 million in senior secured and unsecured notes on September 24, 2025.

2.  A portion of the net proceeds from the offerings will be used to partially fund the previously announced acquisition of Lightning Power, LLC and others, and to repay $500 million of senior secured notes maturing December 2, 2025.
3. The notes were offered to qualified institutional buyers under Rule 144A and to non-U.S. persons under Regulation S, and NRG does not intend to register them for resale.
1. Ricardo Anzaldua, Everest Group, Ltd.'s Executive Vice President and General Counsel, plans to retire in the coming months (as of September 24, 2025).
2.  The company has commenced a search for Anzaldua's successor, with Anzaldua assisting in the transition.
3. No specific future impacts or risks were mentioned in the provided text besides the retirement of a key executive.

1. Blackstone Inc. announced a preliminary estimate of over $525 million in realized performance revenues and principal investment income for the period from July 1, 2025 to September 24, 2025, with over 90% attributed to realized performance revenues.
2. This preliminary estimate represents a significant increase compared to previous periods, though the exact figures for comparison are unavailable in this filing.

3.  Blackstone warns that the actual results for the full third quarter 2025 (ending September 30, 2025) may differ materially from this preliminary estimate, due to potential further gains or losses and the inclusion of additional income and expense factors not accounted for in this interim report.

1. American Tower Corporation (ATC) and AT&T Mexico settled a legal dispute on September 23, 2025, where AT&T Mexico will resume most tower rent payments, with remaining amounts held in escrow pending arbitration.
2.  The legal dispute with AT&T Mexico, which accounted for approximately $300 million in tenant revenue in 2024, resulted in withheld tower rents since the beginning of 2025.

3. The agreement reached includes the release of funds in the escrow account based on a final arbitration ruling or mutual consent, presenting a future risk to ATC's revenue if the arbitration rules against them.
